decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (101.010, unnumbered design and access statement, unnumbered flood risk assessment, received 20/06/2013, 101.001, 101.002, 101.003, 101.004, 101.005, 101.006, 101.007, received 19/08/2013) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the flank walls of the extensions hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The basement shall at no time be used or occupied as a
separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall
not be used as sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until a Construction Method Statement, which is certified by an engineer, giving specific details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on an assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area has been submitted to and been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the
person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate
Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the
details of the membership and contact details are clearly
displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by
members of the public.

Condition : 9 - Some new developments granted planning permission on or after 1st April 2012 will be liable to pay Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) to the Mayor of London with respect to the funding of Crossrail. This is at the rate of ?35 per m2 of new floor space where the net floor area increase exceeds 100 m2 and is estimated as being ?3,780 based on a GIA of 108m2 for the subject scheme.
description: Extension to basement level and creation of habitable space and erection of single storey side and rear extensions
